description: Document specifies packages which can be exluded from license verification. As our code doesn't actually link to them. If no docker_images are provided the package is ignored for all images

jinja2-ansible-filters.notes: Used only for executing ansible as a utility via cmd interface

docutils.notes: botocore imports the package only for dev use. See: https://github.com/boto/botocore/issues/900

ansible.notes: Used only for executing ansible as a utility via cmd interface

ansible-base.notes: Used only for executing ansible as a utility via cmd interface

ansible-core.notes: Used only for executing ansible as a utility via cmd interface

pylint.notes: Used only for executing lint as a utility via cmd interface

incydr.notes: The package has MIT license, however it is not formatted properly in Pypi

ujson.notes: The package has BSD license, however their license was removed from the setup file by their pre-commit see https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/commit/6f767c02a651ec5fa0974cb467fd6a4b8040285e, but they have a BSD license in their license file see https://github.com/ultrajson/ultrajson/blob/main/LICENSE.txt
